original_title: Sri Lanka state agency to develop Singapore designed Western province plan
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A cabinet subcommittee would be appointed and a new agency will be created to implement a Singapore designed development plan for Sri Lanka’s Western Province, President Ranil Wickremesinghe has said.
The plan was developed by Surbana Jurong of Singapore in 2015.

“A Cabinet sub-committee would be appointed to implement the Surbana Jurong plan for the development of the Western Province and a new agency would be established for this purpose,” President Wickremesinghe was quoted as saying in a statement issued by his media office after a meeting with Urban Development Authority, officials.
The idea to set up a new state agency comes as the government tries to close down existing agencies and reduce the burden of the state on the people.

The main development plan proposed to be implemented in the Western Province through the Urban Development Authority, and officials also discussed the release of land and land acquisition for the implementation of development works.
President Ranil Wickremesinghe instructed officials to speed up the work as Western Province contributes about 50 per cent to the country’s economy, making its development crucial.
The first plan to develop the Western Province by the firm was done in 1997 and was updated in 2004 but was not implemented.
President Wickremesinghe also instructed officials to present the development plan for the Eastern Province to the Cabinet as well.  (Colombo/ May15/2023)
